name: Fever
description: Fever is a temporary increase in body temperature, usually due to infection or inflammation. Most fevers resolve within a few days with rest and hydration.

high_risk.definition: High fever or fever with danger signs requiring medical attention

criteria.other_symptoms: breathing difficulty, confusion, persistent vomiting, seizure

self_care: Rest in a cool and comfortable environment
Drink plenty of fluids (water, ORS, coconut water)
Use lukewarm sponging if temperature is high

medicines.name: Paracetamol 500mg Tablet
medicines.used_for: Fever reduction and mild pain relief
medicines.dose: Adults: 500–1000 mg every 6 hours (Maximum 4000 mg in 24 hours)

medicines.name: Ibuprofen 400mg Tablet
medicines.used_for: Fever with inflammation or body pain
medicines.dose: Adults: 400 mg every 6–8 hours with food (Maximum 1200 mg in 24 hours OTC)

doctor_consultation.message: Seek medical attention if fever is severe, persists beyond one week, or is associated with breathing difficulty, confusion, seizures, or persistent vomiting.

assessment_questions.question: How many days have you had the fever?

disclaimer: This is educational information only and not a substitute for professional medical advice. Seek immediate medical care for severe or worsening symptoms.
